blocks.text: Example 19. Given that $s = e^{4t} - 7e^{-t}$, find the value of $\frac{d^{2}s}{dt^{2}} = 258.$

Differentiation of $\log x$ - The rule for the differentiation of logarithmic functions can be derived either from the expression for $\log (x + x)$ or from assigning the result for the differentiation of $f(x)$, considering these methods in turn.
(i) Working with $\log (x + x)$, let $y = \log x$. Then if $x$ increases to $x + \Delta x$, $y$ takes a new value.
Now $\log (y + 8x)$ can be expanded as $\log (x + 8x)$ and therefore,

blocks.description: Logarithmic differentiation of the function with respect to $x$.

blocks.text: Also $8y$ can be expanded into a series of the form

blocks.description: Expansion of the logarithm into a series.
